finalPattern.pattern_name: Framing practical, real-world claims as a myth-busting question in the title (“Do/Does X actually work?”) on outlier topics, paired with a decisive hands-on test, materially increases CTR and expands reach beyond the core audience, yielding 3x+ TPS over the channel baseline.

evidence.title: Do tire balancing beads actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Outlier, practical automotive topic + “actually work?” title + hands-on experiment; TPS far above channel norm.

evidence.title: Do phone signal boosters actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Real-world utility + myth-busting title; non-core viewers searched the claim; above-baseline TPS.

evidence.title: Do magnetic fuel savers actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Common automotive myth with clear pass/fail testing; strong CTR and search pull.

evidence.title: Does blue light blocking eyewear actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Health-adjacent claim, big addressable audience; question title promises resolution.

evidence.title: Do water-repellent windshield coatings actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Hands-on A/B road test; title directly challenges a marketed claim.

evidence.title: Do miracle cleaning sprays actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Broad utility + decisive before/after experiment; strong shareability.

evidence.title: Does grounding/earthing actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Controversial claim draws comments and clicks; testable demonstration retains.

evidence.title: Do ultrasonic pest repellents actually work?
evidence.excerpt: High-search homeowner topic; question-framed promise of a definitive answer.

evidence.title: Do anti-fog sprays actually work on helmets?
evidence.excerpt: Niche but passionate audience; clear, measurable outcome boosts retention.

evidence.title: Do solar trickle chargers actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Practical savings angle; easy-to-grasp setup with binary verdict.

evidence.title: Do blue windshield washer fluids actually work better?
evidence.excerpt: Common assumption challenged; simple testing format.

evidence.title: Does anti-radiation phone sticker actually work?
evidence.excerpt: Debunk-y title with clear pass/fail; strong CTR from skepticism and curiosity.
